doc:
Katherine Corri Harris https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katherine_Corri_Harris 0 Katherine Corri Harris (October 12, 1890 – May 2, 1927) was an American socialite and golfer, who, as a result of her marriage to John Barrymore, appeared in three silent films. The daughter of Sidney and Katharine Maude (nėe Brady) Harris, she grew up in wealth and privilege and was a product of High Society. She was the first wife of the actor John Barrymore, who was her first husband. They were married from 1910 to 1917. After their divorce, she remarried, in 1923, to Alfred D. B. Pratt, a broker; the date on which that union ended is unclear. She married, thirdly, in 1925, to Leon Orlowski (secretary of the Polish Legation); the year that union ended is unknown. As Katherine Harris Barrymore, she appeared in two of Barrymore's now lost silent films: Nearly a King (1916) and The Lost Bridegroom (1916). In 1918, she starred as Lily Bart in the silent film version of Edith Wharton's 1905 novel, The House of Mirth, directed by Albert Capellani.When she died from pneumonia in 1927 in New York City, aged 36, John Barrymore was at her bedside. She was interred in Trinity Church Cemetery and Mausoleum, New York, New York. Katherine_Corri_Harris ( October_12_,_1890 – May_2_,_1927 ) was an_American_socialite_and_golfer , who , as a_result of her_marriage to John_Barrymore , appeared in three_silent_films . The_daughter of Sidney and Katharine_Maude_(_nėe_Brady_)_Harris , she grew up in_wealth_and_privilege and was a_product of High_Society . She was the_first_wife of the_actor_John_Barrymore , who was her_first_husband . They were_married from 1910 to 1917 . After their_divorce , she remarried , in 1923 , to Alfred_D._B._Pratt , a_broker ; the_date on which that_union ended is unclear . She married , thirdly , in 1925 , to Leon_Orlowski ( secretary of the_Polish_Legation_) ; the_year that union ended is unknown . As Katherine_Harris_Barrymore , she appeared in two of Barrymore 's now_lost silent_films : Nearly a_King_(_1916_) and The_Lost_Bridegroom_(_1916_) . In 1918 , she starred as Lily_Bart in the_silent_film_version of Edith_Wharton 's_1905_novel_, The_House of Mirth , directed by Albert_Capellani.When she died from pneumonia in 1927 in New_York_City , aged_36 , John_Barrymore was at her_bedside . She was_interred in Trinity_Church_Cemetery and Mausoleum , New_York , New_York .
